intro: Cyrtandra fusiformis, commonly known as the spindle-shaped heliconia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is characterized by its striking, spiral-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces small, brightly colored flowers that attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
